alert.note: Alert for East Carroll (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 05 at 2:03AM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of eastern Chicot County, northeastern East Carroll Parish, Sunflower, northwestern Leflore, Washington, northwestern Issaquena, Humphreys, southern Bolivar and northern Sharkey Counties through 300 AM CDT... At 203 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles northeast of Jersey Point to near Wayside to Shelburn. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Estill around 215 AM CDT. Leland and Glen Allan around 220 AM CDT. Tribbett and Grace around 225 AM CDT. Renova and Holly Ridge around 230 AM CDT. Anguilla, Nitta Yuma and Panther Burn around 235 AM CDT. Indianola, Inverness and Delta City around 240 AM CDT. Drew around 245 AM CDT. Moorhead, Sunflower and Murphy around 250 AM CDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Mayersville, Silver City, Arcola, Doddsville and Pace. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 400 AM CDT for southeastern Arkansas...northeastern Louisiana...and northwestern and west central Mississippi.
